page.title: 13RELIGION - GODSHILL CHURCH
page.content: The 14th Century church of All Saints stands on a tree and flower covered hill on the site chosen by God (see Supernatural - Godshill). The Island's largest Medieval church, it has twin naves, chancels and transepts and a fortified square tower. The S.transept chapel has a 15th Century mural of Christ crucified on a 3-branched lily cross, unique in England. Once the monastic church of Appuldurcombe, ancestral home of the Worsleys, it is rich with Worsley monuments; Sir James and Lady Anne kneel in the E.chancel; Sir Richard is commemorated by a 30 ton sarcophagus; Sir John and Lady Agnes Leigh,parents of Lady Anne, lie under a stone canopy, his feet resting on a pig, their soles carved with "The Weepers", counting their rosary beads.
